parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided text.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions and promotes the PNL (Partidul Național Liberal), a parliamentary candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended for a wide audience, not just a specific individual.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>True. The primary objective of the post is to persuade voters to choose the PNL in the upcoming elections.  Phrases like "Votul pentru PNL este votul pentru o Rom\u00e2nie modern\u0103," and "Vota\u021bi PNL pentru o Rom\u00e2nie puternic\u0103 \u00een Europa" directly advocate for voting for the PNL.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>False. While the post presents some information about the PNL's platform, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. It's primarily promotional material, not an unbiased news piece.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; instead, it promotes a specific political party and its agenda.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1556211045019020</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post promotes the PNL party, directly urging voters to support them.  The post's language is persuasive and promotional, aiming to influence voting behavior. The paid nature of the advertisement on a public platform further strengthens the argument that it constitutes electoral propaganda. The content goes beyond simply informing the public about the PNL; it actively advocates for their election.  The image shows a person voting, which could be interpreted as implicitly endorsing the act of voting for a candidate. While the post doesn't explicitly mention a specific candidate's name, it clearly promotes the PNL party, which is participating in the parliamentary elections. The post's timing, close to election day, further increases the likelihood of influencing voters.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Dumitru Rujan</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Dumitru Rujan, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 1556211045019020) cu caracter de propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie, respectiv după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024,  postare care promovează explicit Partidul Național Liberal (PNL) și îndeamnă la votarea acestuia.  Postarea, plătită cu o sumă sub 100 RON, a generat între 1000 și 2000 de impresii, având o estimare a acoperirii de 100.000 - 500.000 de persoane. Fraze precum „Votul pentru PNL este votul pentru o Românie modernă” și „Votați PNL pentru o Românie puternică în Europa” demonstrează clar intenția de a influența votul în favoarea PNL.  Contactul advertiserului este topliceanuflorin@yahoo.com și +40767242025.  Imaginea atașată postării prezintă o persoană votând, ceea ce poate fi interpretat ca o aprobare implicită a actului de votare pentru un candidat.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
